meanings.definition: The state of being dirty or grimy.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the children's clothes were covered in grubbiness.
meanings.sent2: The old abandoned house was filled with grubbiness and dust.
meanings.sent3: Despite her efforts, the grubbiness of the kitchen seemed to multiply overnight.
meanings.sent4: The grubbiness of the city streets mirrored the neglect of its residents.
meanings.sent5: The grubbiness of the alley was so intense that even the rats avoided it.

meanings.definition: A feeling of being unkempt or messy.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the grubbiness she felt after a long day of work.
meanings.sent2: The grubbiness of his appearance made him stand out in the elegant party.
meanings.sent3: Despite her stylish outfit, she couldn't hide the grubbiness she felt inside.
meanings.sent4: The grubbiness of his thoughts reflected in his disheveled appearance.
meanings.sent5: The grubbiness of the situation made her long for a fresh start.
